sen.j: 高野 長英（たかの ちょうえい、文化 (元号)元年5月5日 (旧暦)（1804年6月12日） - 嘉永3年10月30日 (旧暦)（1850年12月3日））は、江戸時代後期の医者・蘭学者である。
sen.e: Choei TAKANO (June 12, 1804 - December 13, 1850) was a doctor and a Dutch scholar who lived during the late Edo Period.
Choei TAKANO (June 12, 1804 - December 3, 1850) was a doctor and Dutch scholar who lived during the late Edo Period.
sen.cmt: ・没年月日の修正をしました。・Dutch scholarの前の不定冠詞を削除。
sen.e: Choei TAKANO (June 12, 1804 - December 3, 1850) was a doctor and Dutch scholar who lived during the late Edo Period.

sen.j: 通称は悦三郎、諱は譲（ゆずる）。
sen.e: His common name was Etsusaburo and his imina (personal name) was Yuzuru.
His common name was Etsusaburo and his imina (personal name) was Yuzuru.
His common name was Etsusaburo and his imina (personal name) was Yuzuru.

sen.j: 号は瑞皐（ずいこう）。
sen.e: His go (pen name) was Zuiko.
His go (pen name) was Zuiko.
His go (pen name) was Zuiko.

sen.j: 父は後藤実慶。
sen.e: His biological father was 実慶 GOTO.
sen.cmt: 後藤実慶：読み方不明です。
sen.e: His father was Sanenobu GOTO.
sen.cmt: ・下に続く文言との関係からbiological fatherとしたものと思われますが、普通にfatherで問題ないと判断しました。・「実慶」は「さねよし」の可能性もあります。
sen.e: His father was Sanenobu GOTO.

sen.j: 養父は叔父・高野玄斎。
sen.e: Choei was fostered by his uncle, Gensai TAKANO.
Choei was fostered by his uncle, Gensai TAKANO.
Choei was fostered by his uncle, Gensai TAKANO.

sen.j: 江戸幕府の異国船打払令を批判し開国を説くが、弾圧を受け、それを見ることなく亡くなった。
sen.e: Choei criticized the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by the TOKUGAWA family) for enforcing the 'Order for the Repelling of Foreign Ships' and maintained the importance of opening Japan to the world, but he died in repression from the bakufu without seeing his own country open its gates to the world.

Choei criticized the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by the TOKUGAWA family) for enforcing the Order for the Repelling of Foreign Ships and argued for opening Japan to the world, but he died in the bakufu's repression without seeing the opening of the country to the world.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: Choei criticized the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by the TOKUGAWA family) for enforcing the Order for the Repelling of Foreign Ships and argued for opening Japan to the world, but he died in the bakufu's repression without seeing the opening of the country to the world.

sen.j: しかし、開国が実現した後（1898年（明治31年）7月4日）、その功績により位階を追贈された。
sen.e: After opening of Japan (June 4, 1898), however, Choei was conferred a court rank for the honorable acts.
After the opening of Japan to the world, however, Choei was conferred a court rank for the achievements in July 4, 1898.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: After the opening of Japan to the world, however, Choei was conferred a court rank for the achievements in July 4, 1898.

sen.j: 陸奥国（後の陸前国）仙台藩水沢藩留守氏の藩医出身。
sen.e: Choei started his career as a Domain doctor of the Rusu clan of the Mizusawa Domain, a branch family of the Sendai Domain, of Mutsu Province (later Rikuzen Province).
Choei started his career as a domain doctor of the Rusu clan of the Mizusawa Domain, a branch domain of the Sendai Domain, of Mutsu Province (later Rikuzen Province).
sen.cmt: a Domain doctorとしていますが、大文字にする必要はないと判断しました。
sen.e: Choei started his career as a domain doctor of the Rusu clan of the Mizusawa Domain, a branch domain of the Sendai Domain, of Mutsu Province (later Rikuzen Province).

sen.j: 養父玄斎は江戸で杉田玄白に蘭法医術を学んだことから家には蘭書が多く、長英も幼いころから新しい学問に強い関心を持つようになった。
sen.e: As his foster father, Gensai, learned Western medicine under Genpaku SUGITA in Edo and had a lot of Western books at home, Choei had strongly become interested in learning new areas of study since he was young.
As his foster father, Gensai, studied Western medicine under Genpaku SUGITA in Edo and had a lot of Western books at home, Choei had strongly become interested in studying since he was young.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: As his foster father, Gensai, studied Western medicine under Genpaku SUGITA in Edo and had a lot of Western books at home, Choei had strongly become interested in studying since he was young.

sen.j: 文政3年（1820年）、江戸に赴き杉田伯元や吉田長淑に師事。
sen.e: In 1820, Choei moved to Edo and became a disciple of Hakugen SUGITA (a Dutch doctor) and Choshuku YOSHIDA (a Dutch doctor).
In 1820, Choei moved to Edo and studied under Hakugen SUGITA and Choshuku YOSHIDA, both of whom were Dutch doctors.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: In 1820, Choei moved to Edo and studied under Hakugen SUGITA and Choshuku YOSHIDA, both of whom were Dutch doctors.

sen.j: この江戸生活で吉田長淑に才能を認められ、師の長の文字を貰い受けて「長英」を名乗った。
sen.e: Choei's excellent talent in medical science was found by Choshuku YOSHIDA while learning in Edo, and Choei was given his master's name and called, 'Choei'.
Recognizing his talent, Choshuku allowed him to call himself Choei by giving him his name 'Cho.'
sen.cmt: 表現の簡略化をしました。
sen.e: Recognizing his talent, Choshuku allowed him to call himself Choei by giving him his name 'Cho.'

sen.j: その後長崎に留学してフィリップ・フランツ・フォン・シーボルトの鳴滝塾で医学・蘭学を学び、その抜きん出た学力から塾頭となっている。
sen.e: Later, Choei moved to Nagasaki for learning medical science and Western studies at the Narutakijuku founded by Philipp Franz von Siebold, where he was appointed as a school manager for his outstanding academic ability.

Later, Choei moved to Nagasaki for learning medical science and Western studies at the Narutakijuku founded by Philipp Franz von Siebold, where he was appointed as a school manager for his outstanding academic ability.

Later, Choei moved to Nagasaki for learning medical science and Western studies at the Narutakijuku founded by Philipp Franz von Siebold, where he was appointed as a school manager for his outstanding academic ability.

sen.j: 文政11年（1828年）、シーボルト事件が起き、二宮敬作や高良斎など主だった弟子も捕らえられて厳しい詮議を受けたが、長英はこのとき巧みに逃れている。
sen.e: In 1828, when Siebold Incident occurred, major disciples such as Keisaku NINOMIYA and Ryosai Ko were arrested and faced harsh investigation, but Choei managed to elude the arrest cleverly.
In 1828, when the Siebold Incident occurred, some of his disciples such as Keisaku NINOMIYA and Ryosai Ko were arrested and faced harsh investigation, but Choei managed to elude the arrest cleverly.
sen.cmt: 「主だった弟子」は普通に「彼の弟子」の意で文字通りの意ではないと判断しました。
sen.e: In 1828, when the Siebold Incident occurred, some of his disciples such as Keisaku NINOMIYA and Ryosai Ko were arrested and faced harsh investigation, but Choei managed to elude the arrest cleverly.

sen.j: まもなく豊後国日田（現在の大分県日田市）の広瀬淡窓に弟子入りしたという（異説もある）。
sen.e: According to one heresy, Choei became a pupil of Tanso HIROSE of Hita, Bungo Province (present-day, Hita City, Oita Prefecture) before long.
According to one heresy, Choei became a pupil of Tanso HIROSE of Hita, Bungo Province (present-day, Hita City, Oita Prefecture) before long.
According to one heresy, Choei became a pupil of Tanso HIROSE of Hita, Bungo Province (present-day, Hita City, Oita Prefecture) before long.

sen.j: この間、義父玄斎が亡くなっており、長英は故郷から盛んに帰郷を求められるが、逡巡したもののついに拒絶。
sen.e: During this period, his foster father, Gensai, died and Choei was repeatedly called for his return by his family to succeed to the reign of the family, but he finally refused the request after some hesitation.
Following the death of his foster father, Gensai, the Takano family repeatedly asked him to return home, but he decided not to return after some hesitation.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: Following the death of his foster father, Gensai, the Takano family repeatedly asked him to return home, but he decided not to return after some hesitation.

sen.j: 家督を捨て、同時に武士の身分を失っている。
sen.e: By giving up the family reigns, Choei also lost the social status as samurai at the same time.
In addition to giving up taking over as head of the family, he lost the social status as samurai.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: In addition to giving up taking over as head of the family, he lost the social status as samurai.

sen.j: 天保元年（1830年）江戸に戻り、町医者と蘭学塾を開業した。
sen.e: In 1830, Choei returned to Edo to practice medicine as a town doctor and established a private school for Western studies.
In 1830, Choei returned to Edo to practice medicine as a town doctor and established a private school for Western studies.
In 1830, Choei returned to Edo to practice medicine as a town doctor and established a private school for Western studies.

sen.j: まもなく三河国田原藩重役渡辺崋山と知り合い、その能力を買われて田原藩のお雇い蘭学者として小関三英や鈴木春山とともに蘭学書の翻訳に当たった。
sen.e: After a short while, Choei got acquainted with Kazan WATANABE, a senior vassal of the Tahara Domain of Mikawa Province, and was offered a post of a Dutch scholar at the Domain for his brilliant talent, where Choei was assigned to translate Western-study materials with Sanei KOSEKI and Shunzan SUZUKI.

After a short while, Choei got acquainted with Kazan WATANABE, a senior vassal of the Tahara Domain of Mikawa Province and was employed as a Dutch scholar at the domain for his brilliant talent, where he translated Western studies literature with Sanei KOSEKI and Shunzan SUZUKI.
sen.cmt: ・表現の修正をしました。・at the Domainとなっていますが、大文字にする必要はないと判断しました。
sen.e: After a short while, Choei got acquainted with Kazan WATANABE, a senior vassal of the Tahara Domain of Mikawa Province and was employed as a Dutch scholar at the domain for his brilliant talent, where he translated Western studies literature with Sanei KOSEKI and Shunzan SUZUKI.

sen.j: 天保3年（1832年）、紀州藩儒官遠藤勝助らによって天保の大飢饉の対策会として作られた学問サークルである尚歯会に入り、崋山らとともに中心的役割を担った。
sen.e: In 1832, Choei joined an academic circle, 'Shoshi-kai', which was founded by Katsusuke ENDO, a Confucianism teacher of the Kishu Domain, to discuss measures against the imminent Tempo Famine, where Choei played a central role along with Kazan.

In 1832, Choei joined Shoshi-kai, which was founded as an academic circle addressing the Tempo Famine by Shosuke ENDO, a Confucianism teacher of the Kishu Domain, and played a central role in it along with Kazan.
sen.cmt: ・表現の簡略化をしました。・「遠藤勝助」はウェブ検索では「しょうすけ」と紹介していることが多いのでこちらを採用しました（「かつすけ」も一部あり）。
sen.e: In 1832, Choei joined Shoshi-kai, which was founded as an academic circle addressing the Tempo Famine by Shosuke ENDO, a Confucianism teacher of the Kishu Domain, and played a central role in it along with Kazan.

sen.j: 長英の『救荒二物考』などの著作はこの成果である。
sen.e: Choei compiled "Kyuko Nibutsu ko" based on the agricultural approaches they took at this time.
Some of his writings such as "Kyuko Nibustsuko," which described about agricultural approaches to take to combat famines, resulted from his participation in Shoshi-kai.
Some of his writings such as "Kyuko Nibustsuko," which described about agricultural approaches to take to combat famines, resulted from his participation in Shoshi-kai.

sen.j: 長英の優秀な語学力を示す有名なエピソードとして、次のようなものがある。
sen.e: One episode proving Choei's excellent language ability is that at a banquet held by pupils of Narutakejuku, they played a game in which only Dutch is allowed to speak, otherwise penalties would be fined.
The following episode demonstrates Choei's excellent language ability.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The following episode demonstrates Choei's excellent language ability.

sen.j: 鳴滝塾出身者の宴会で、オランダ語以外の言葉を使うと罰金をとるという決まりが設けられた。
sen.e: The pupils of Narutakijuku held a banquet, in which they would be fined if they spoke other languages than Dutch.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The pupils of Narutakijuku held a banquet, in which they would be fined if they spoke other languages than Dutch.

sen.j: 多くの者は酒が入るうちついつい日本語をしゃべって罰金を取られていたが、長英のみオランダ語を使い続けていた。
sen.e: Most of the participants could not help but speak in Japanese as more alcohol went down their throat and ended up paying penalties, but only Choei kept talking in Dutch.
While most of the participants, who, drunk, spoke Japanese carelessly, were fined, only Choei kept talking in Dutch.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: While most of the participants, who, drunk, spoke Japanese carelessly, were fined, only Choei kept talking in Dutch.

sen.j: それを妬んだ仲間の伊東玄朴が、長英を階段から突き落とし長英は「GEVAARLIKI!」（オランダ語で「危ない！」）と叫んだ。
sen.e: When Genboku ITO, a fellow pupil, was too jealous of Choei's talent and shoved Choei to fall down stairs, Choei screamed in Dutch, 'GEVAARLIKI!' (watch out!).
When Genboku ITO, a fellow pupil, pushed him down a flight of stairs out of jealousy for his talent, he screamed in Dutch, 'GEVAARLIKI!' (Watch out!).
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: When Genboku ITO, a fellow pupil, pushed him down a flight of stairs out of jealousy for his talent, he screamed in Dutch, 'GEVAARLIKI!' (Watch out!).

sen.j: 長英自身才能を鼻にかけて増長する傾向があり、仲間内の評判も悪かったが、当時最高の実力の蘭学者として周囲は認めざるを得なかった。
sen.e: It seems true that Choei tended to be swellheaded for his brilliance and was ill-reputed among peers, but it was also a widely recognized fact that he was the best of the best Dutch scholars at that time.
Because Choei tended to be swellheaded for his brilliance, he was not popular with his peers, but they recognized him as the best Dutch scholar at that time.
sen.cmt: 表現の簡略化をしました。
sen.e: Because Choei tended to be swellheaded for his brilliance, he was not popular with his peers, but they recognized him as the best Dutch scholar at that time.

sen.j: 天保8年（1837年）、異国船打払令に基づいてアメリカ合衆国船籍の商船モリソン号が打ち払われるモリソン号事件が起きた。
sen.e: In 1837, the so-called Morrison Incident occurred, in which an American merchant ship, Morrison, was expelled with gunfire in accordance with the Order for the Repelling of Foreign Ships.

In 1837, the Morrison Incident occurred when an American merchant ship named Morrison was driven away from a Japanese coast by cannon fire in accordance with the Order for the Repelling of Foreign Ships.
sen.cmt: ・表現の修正をしました。・so-called使用の意図が分からないので、削除しました。・ウィキペディアではモリソン号はcannon fireで砲撃となっているので、こちらを採用しました。
sen.e: In 1837, the Morrison Incident occurred when an American merchant ship named Morrison was driven away from a Japanese coast by cannon fire in accordance with the Order for the Repelling of Foreign Ships.

sen.j: この際長英は「無茶なことだ、やめておけ」と述べており、崋山らとともに幕府の対応を批判している。
sen.e: At that time, Choei criticized the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) with Kazan for its expulsion of the ship Morrison by saying 'it is a reckless action. It is wise not to do it'.
Choei criticized the bakufu with Kazan for its repelling of the ship Morrison by saying, 'Such a stupidity. Stop it.'
sen.cmt: 幕府は先に補足説明を行ったので、再度の説明は不要と判断しました。
sen.e: Choei criticized the bakufu with Kazan for its repelling of the ship Morrison by saying, 'Such a stupidity. Stop it.'

sen.j: 長英はそうした意見をまとめた『戊戌夢物語』を著し、内輪で回覧に供した（ただし、長英の想像を超えてこの本は多くの学者の間で出回っている）。
sen.e: Choei summarized his opinion on the Incident in "Bojutsu Yume Monogatari" (literally, a fantasy in the Bojutsu year) and circulated it internally (however, this book was read by a lot more scholars than Choei had expected).

Choei summarized his opinions on the incident in "Bojutsu Yume Monogatari" (literally, a fantasy in the Bojutsu year), which was read internally (however, against his expectations, this book became well-known among many scholars).
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: Choei summarized his opinions on the incident in "Bojutsu Yume Monogatari" (literally, a fantasy in the Bojutsu year), which was read internally (however, against his expectations, this book became well-known among many scholars).

sen.j: 天保10年（1839年）、蛮社の獄が勃発。
sen.e: In 1839, Bansha no goku (Imprisonment of scholars of Western learning) broke out.
In 1839, Bansha no goku (Imprisonment of scholars of Western learning) broke out.
In 1839, Bansha no goku (Imprisonment of scholars of Western learning) broke out.

sen.j: 長英も幕政批判のかどで捕らえられ、永牢の判決が下って伝馬町牢屋敷に収監。
sen.e: Choei was arrested for criticizing the bakufu and imprisoned in Denmacho after sentenced to life in prison.
Choei was arrested for criticizing the bakufu and imprisoned in Denmacho after having been sentenced to life in prison.
sen.cmt: 時系列の明確化をしました。
sen.e: Choei was arrested for criticizing the bakufu and imprisoned in Denmacho after having been sentenced to life in prison.

sen.j: 牢内では服役者の医療に努め、また劣悪な牢内環境の改善なども訴えた。
sen.e: In the prison, he was engaged in medical care of prisoners and also calling for an improvement of poor prison environment.
In prison, he was engaged in medical care of prisoners and also called for the improvement of the poor prison environment.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: In prison, he was engaged in medical care of prisoners and also called for the improvement of the poor prison environment.

sen.j: これらの行動と親分肌の気性から牢名主として祭り上げられるようになった。
sen.e: These acts and his characteristic of taking care of people encouraged him to hold a title of 'ronanushi', a leader of prisoners, who was in charge of arranging fatigues and maintaining order behind bars.
Other prisoners respected him as 'ronanushi' (head of prisoners) for these acts and his boss person character.
sen.cmt: 「牢名主」の詳細説明は必要なしと判断しました。
sen.e: Other prisoners respected him as 'ronanushi' (head of prisoners) for these acts and his boss person character.

sen.j: 弘化元年（1844年）6月30日 (旧暦)、牢屋敷の火災に乗じて脱獄。
sen.e: On June 30, 1844 (the old calendar), Choei escaped from the prison when a fire broke out.
On June 30, 1844, Choei escaped from prison when a fire broke out at the prison.
sen.cmt: ・表現の修正・出典元には（旧暦）の記載がなかったので削除しました。
sen.e: On June 30, 1844, Choei escaped from prison when a fire broke out at the prison.

sen.j: この火災は、長英が牢で働いていた非人栄蔵をそそのかして放火させたとの説が有力である。
sen.e: A widely accepted theory is that this fire was deliberately lit by one of hinin (one group comprising the lowest rank of Japan's Edo-period caste system, often ex-convicts or vagrants), Eizo, who worked in the prison and it was Choei who coaxed him into setting fire to the place.

According to a widely-accepted theory, Choei coaxed a prison worker named Eizo who belonged to hinin (one group comprising the lowest rank of Japan's Edo-period caste system, often ex-convicts or vagrants) into setting fire to the place.
sen.cmt: 表現の簡略化をしました。
sen.e: According to a widely-accepted theory, Choei coaxed a prison worker named Eizo who belonged to hinin (one group comprising the lowest rank of Japan's Edo-period caste system, often ex-convicts or vagrants) into setting fire to the place.

sen.j: その後の経路は詳しくは不明ながらも（江戸では人相書きが出回っていたためと言われている）薬品で顔を変えて逃亡生活を送った。
sen.e: Although his escape routes were not exactly known, Choei literally changed his face with chemicals to live as a fugitive (because Choei's portrait was circulated in Edo).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Although his escape routes were not exactly known, Choei changed his face with chemicals to live as a fugitive (because Choei's descriptions were circulated in Edo).
sen.cmt: literallyを使用する必要性が不明なので、削除しました。
sen.e: Although his escape routes were not exactly known, Choei changed his face with chemicals to live as a fugitive (because Choei's descriptions were circulated in Edo).

sen.j: そして一時江戸に入り、鈴木春山に匿われて兵学書の翻訳を行うも春山が急死。
sen.e: He later entered Edo, where he was given shelter by Shunzan SUZUKI and spent time translating military science books, but Shunzan died soon afterward.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He later entered Edo, where he was given shelter by Shunzan SUZUKI and spent time translating military science books, but Shunzan died suddenly.
sen.cmt: 翻訳では「春山は～の出来事の後間もなく死んだ」となっており、急死とは異なるので修正しました。
sen.e: He later entered Edo, where he was given shelter by Shunzan SUZUKI and spent time translating military science books, but Shunzan died suddenly.

sen.j: その後、鳴滝塾時代の同門・二宮敬作の案内で伊予国宇和島藩主伊達宗城に庇護され、宗城の下で兵法書など蘭学書の翻訳や、宇和島藩の兵備の洋式化に従事した。
sen.e: And then, Choei was taken under the wing of Munenari DATE, the lord of the Uwajima Domain of Iyo Province, with the help of Keisaku NINOMIYA, one of Narutakijuku peers, where Choei was engaged in the translation work of Western-study books including strategy books and also in westernization of the army of the Uwajima Domain under Munenari.

And then, Choei, taken under the wing of Munenari DATE, the lord of the Uwajima Domain of Iyo Province, with the help of Keisaku NINOMIYA, one of Narutakijuku peers, was engaged in the translation of Western studies literature including strategy books as well as in the westernization of the domain's military equipment under Munenari.
sen.cmt: ・表現の修正をしました。・「兵備」は「軍事機材」としました。
sen.e: And then, Choei, taken under the wing of Munenari DATE, the lord of the Uwajima Domain of Iyo Province, with the help of Keisaku NINOMIYA, one of Narutakijuku peers, was engaged in the translation of Western studies literature including strategy books as well as in the westernization of the domain's military equipment under Munenari.

sen.j: 主な半翻訳本に砲家必読11冊がある。
sen.e: Major translations he made in this Domain include 11 volumes of 'Hoka Hitsudoku' (guidelines on gun battery).
sen.cmt: 半翻訳本：「半」では意味が通じませんので、「藩」で訳しています。
sen.e: Hoka Hitsudoku (literary, guidelines on gun battery) (Vol. 1-11) is one of his main translations.
sen.cmt: ・表現の修正・「半翻訳本」の意味は不明ですが、普通に「翻訳本」としました。
sen.e: Hoka Hitsudoku (literary, guidelines on gun battery) (Vol. 1-11) is one of his main translations.

sen.j: このとき彼が築いた久良砲台（愛南町久良）は当時としては最高の技術を結集したものとされる。
sen.e: Also, the Hisayoshi gun battery (Hisayoshi, Ainan Town) which Choei designed during this period is said to have been built with the best-in-class techniques incorporated at that time.
The Hisayoshi gun battery (Hisayoshi, Ainan Town) built by Choei during this period is reputed to be the crystallization of the best technology of that time.
sen.cmt: 表現の簡略化をしました。
sen.e: The Hisayoshi gun battery (Hisayoshi, Ainan Town) built by Choei during this period is reputed to be the crystallization of the best technology of that time.

sen.j: しかし、この生活も長く続かず、しばらくして江戸に戻り、沢三伯の偽名を使って町医者を開業した。
sen.e: However, this kind of life could not last for long, and Choei was again back to Edo after a while and became a town doctor under a false name of Sanpaku SAWA.
sen.cmt: 沢三伯：読み方不明です。
sen.e: However, he returned to Edo after a while and started to work as a town doctor under the false name of Sanpaku SAWA.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: However, he returned to Edo after a while and started to work as a town doctor under the false name of Sanpaku SAWA.

sen.j: 医者になれば人と対面する機会が多くなるため、その中の誰かに見破られる事も十分に考えられた。
sen.e: He acknowledged a risk of being discovered by his own patient, because he as a doctor would have more chances to see people face to face.
He was highly likely to be recognized because he, as a doctor, would have more chances to see people face to face.
sen.cmt: 翻訳では「患者に見破られる」となっていますが、そこまで限定的に記述されていないので削除しました。
sen.e: He was highly likely to be recognized because he, as a doctor, would have more chances to see people face to face.

sen.j: そのため硝酸で顔を焼いて人相を変えていたとされている。
sen.e: To reduce the risk, it is said that Choei burned his face with nitric acid to make his face look different.
To reduce such risk, Choei reportedly burned his face with nitric acid to change his face.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: To reduce such risk, Choei reportedly burned his face with nitric acid to change his face.

sen.j: 嘉永3年（1850年）10月30日、江戸の青山百人町（現在の東京・青山 (東京都港区)）に潜伏していたところを町奉行所に踏み込まれて捕縛された。
sen.e: On October 30, 1850, Choei was raided and captured by officers of a town magistrate's office when he hid out in Hyakunin-cho, Aoyama, Edo (present-day, Aoyama, Tokyo).
On October 30, 1850, the town magistrate's office raided his hiding place in Aoyamahyakunin-cho (present-day, Aoyama, Tokyo [Minato Ward, Tokyo]) and captured him.
sen.cmt: 「青山百人町」はこれで一つの地名と思われます。
sen.e: On October 30, 1850, the town magistrate's office raided his hiding place in Aoyamahyakunin-cho (present-day, Aoyama, Tokyo [Minato Ward, Tokyo]) and captured him.

sen.j: 何人もの捕方に十手で殴打され、縄をかけられたときは既に半死半生だった。
sen.e: As Choei was badly beaten by officers with jutte (short one hook truncheon), he was half dead when bound with a rope.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Badly beaten by officers with jutte (short one hook truncheon), he was half dead when bound with a rope.
sen.cmt: 表現の簡略化をしました。
sen.e: Badly beaten by officers with jutte (short one hook truncheon), he was half dead when bound with a rope.

sen.j: そこで、やむを得ず駕籠で護送する最中に絶命（現場にいたある捕手役人の覚書。奉行所に提出された報告書では、奮戦した後、喉を突いて自害したとある）。
sen.e: Therefore, the officers killed Choei while transporting him in a palanquin (according to the memorandum written by one of the officers who captured Choei.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The authorities therefore killed Choei while transporting him in a palanquin (from the memorandum written by one of the officers who captured Choei. However, according to the report submitted to the magistrate's office, Choei killed himself by stabbing him in the throat after some fights).
sen.cmt: ・括弧内の文言が分割されているので、結合しました。・表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: The authorities therefore killed Choei while transporting him in a palanquin (from the memorandum written by one of the officers who captured Choei. However, according to the report submitted to the magistrate's office, Choei killed himself by stabbing him in the throat after some fights).

sen.j: 江戸において勝海舟と会談した、或いは勝に匿ってもらっていたという話も伝えられている。
sen.e: There is also a story that Choei met Kaishu KATSU (Japanese naval officer and statesman) or was given shelter by KATSU in Edo.
Some people also say that Choei met Kaishu KATSU or was given shelter by him in Edo.
sen.cmt: ・表現の修正をしました。・勝海舟の補足説明は不要と判断しました。
sen.e: Some people also say that Choei met Kaishu KATSU or was given shelter by him in Edo.

sen.j: 主著に1837年のモリソン号事件の際の幕府の異国船打払令を批判した『戊戌夢物語』など。
sen.e: The most famous writings of his is "Bojutsu Yume Monogatari" which criticizes the bakufu for expelling the ship Morrison in accordance with the Order for the Repelling of Foreign Ships.
His important writings include "Bojutsu Yume Monogatari" which criticized the bakufu for repelling the ship Morrison in accordance with the Order for the Repelling of Foreign Ships.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: His important writings include "Bojutsu Yume Monogatari" which criticized the bakufu for repelling the ship Morrison in accordance with the Order for the Repelling of Foreign Ships.

sen.j: また、オランダ語文献の翻訳作業も多く行っている。
sen.e: Also, Choei was engaged in translating numerous Dutch literature.
Also, Choei was engaged in translating numerous Dutch literature.
Also, Choei was engaged in translating numerous Dutch literature.

sen.j: 岩手県水沢市（現・奥州市）では、長英は三偉人（高野長英、斎藤実、後藤新平）の一人として扱われていた。
sen.e: In Mizusawa City, Iwate Prefecture (present-day, Oshu City), Choei was honored as one of three heroes (Choei TAKANO, Minoru SAITO and Shinpei GOTO).
In Mizusawa City, Iwate Prefecture (present-day, Oshu City), Choei was honored as one of three heroes (Choei TAKANO, Makoto SAITO and Shinpei GOTO).
sen.cmt: 「斎藤実」の読みを修正しました。
sen.e: In Mizusawa City, Iwate Prefecture (present-day, Oshu City), Choei was honored as one of three heroes (Choei TAKANO, Makoto SAITO and Shinpei GOTO).

sen.j: また、小学校ではよく総合的な学習の時間で取り上げられ、その生涯、功績を学んでいる。
sen.e: Also, Choei is frequently featured in class of elementary schools and his life and achievements are handed down to younger generations.
In addition, many elementary schools feature Choei in the integrated learning period to hand down his life and achievements to younger generations.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: In addition, many elementary schools feature Choei in the integrated learning period to hand down his life and achievements to younger generations.

sen.j: また、平成16年（2004年）には高野長英の生誕200年ということで、水沢では色々なイベントが行われた。
sen.e: In 2004, Mizusawa City celebrated the 200th anniversary of Choei's birth and various events were held.
In 2004, Mizusawa City celebrated the 200th anniversary of Choei's birth and various events were held.
